p: In contrast to the uniform changes in TMX3day and TNX3day, the change magnitudes of HWs show regional differences, with larger magnitudes in the low-altitude areas ( Figure 4). A notable increase lasting more than seven days mainly occurs in the south of CA (except for the Pamir Mountains) under the INDC scenario. The population density-weighted average changes are more intense in UZB, TKM, and TJK ( Figure 5). The spatial patterns are similar, but the changes in the HWs under the 2.0°C/1.5°C scenarios are less significant compared with the INDC scenario ( Figure 4). Record-breaking HW events will also remarkably increase (similar to TMX3day and TNX3day); approximately 55%/51% of the population/area in CA will break the historical record under the INDC-pledge scenario. The increased amount of record-breaking HW events will be more evident in TKM and UZB.
